#summary Installing  EasyGSP
= Installing EasyGSP =

EasyGSP requires Java 1.6 or greater and an HTTP server such as LightTPD or Apache.

==Linux==

There are a ton of tutorials on how to install all of the required software for EasyGSP.  Simply google installation instructions for installing the following for your distro:
  * Install Sun's latest JDK
  * Install LightTPD  (If you decide to build from source make sure you build with: --with-mysql ,--with-openssl) or Apache HTTP Server

* Installing Lighttpd on Ubuntu/Debian *  

  {{{
  $ sudo apt-get install lighttpd
  }}}


* Installing EasyGSP *
{{{
  $ cd /opt
  $ wget http://easygsp.googlecode.com/files/easygsp-0.4.5.tar.gz
  $ tar -xvf easygsp-0.4.5.tar.gz
  $ rm easygsp-0.4.5.tar.gz
  $ ln -s easygsp-0.4.5 easygsp
  $ cd easygsp/bin
  $ chmod +x start.sh
  $ cdmod +x stop.sh
}}}
* Create Environment Variables *
  add the following lines to /etc/profile
  {{{
  EASYGSP_HOME=/opt/easygsp-0.4.5
  JAVA_HOME=/opt/java/jdk1.6.0_21

  export EASYGSP_HOME
  export JAVA_HOME
  export PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME/bin
   }}}

   Logout and log back in or try 
   {{{
   $ source /etc/profile
   }}}

   Test that env variables are working
   {{{
   $ echo $JAVA_HOME
   $ echo $EASY_HOME
   }}}

* Download EasyGSP Lighty Config *
{{{
$ wget http://easygsp.googlecode.com/files/lighttpd.conf
}}}
  
*  Replace original lighttpd config file with downloaded one  *
{{{
$ mv /etc/lighttpd/lighttpd.conf /etc/lighttpd/lighttpd.conf_old 
$ mv lighttpd.conf /etc/lighttpd/lighttpd.conf
}}}

*  Restart lighttpd *
{{{
$ /etc/init.d/lighttpd restart 
}}}


* Start EasyGSP *
{{{
$ cd /opt/easygsp/bin
$ ./start.sh
}}}

* on Ubuntu *
{{{
$ sudo -E ./start.sh 
}}}

* Open browser, goto   *
  http://localhost:8085/examples

If all is well, you should see something like this:
http://easygsp.googlecode.com/files/startup-linux.png

==Windows==
  * *Install Java*
    # Download the latest jdk from http://java.sun.com
    # Install
    # Create JAVA_HOME environment variable

  * *Install LightTPD(Preferred)*
    # Goto the WMLP Project Site http://en.wlmp-project.net/downloads.php 
    # Download the latest and greatest w/OpenSSL support
    # Install to c:\LightTPD

  * or Install Apache
    # The Apache HTTP server is available for Windows from [http://httpd.apache.org   apache.org]
    # Or you could download an all in one solution like [http://www.apachefriends.org/en/index.html Apache Friends] windows install.

     
  * *Configure HTTP Server*
    # See Configure LightTPD and Apache sections below.
    

  * *Installing EasyGSP*
    # Download EasyGSP @ http://code.google.com/p/easygsp/downloads/list
    # Unzip to c:\
    # Rename dir c:\easygsp-`[VERSION`] to c:\easygsp
    # Create EASYGSP_HOME environment variable that points to c:\easygsp

  * *Start EasyGSP*
    # c:\easygsp\EasyGSP.bat

==Configuring LightTPD==

Download one of the minimal config files or manually update your existing config file.

Current file locations:
     # Linux  - /etc/lighttpd/lighttpd.conf
     # Windows - c:/LightTPD/lighttpd-inc.conf 

Download config file from:
  Linux
    # http://easygsp.googlecode.com/files/lighttpd.conf
  Windows(WLMP)
    # http://easygsp.googlecode.com/files/lighttpd-inc.conf


*Or manually update config file:*

Basically, you enable mod_scgi, setup up the scgi_server and extensions, prevent the groovy, gsp and gpsx pages from being served by Lighttpd and add the EasyGSP pages to the welcome/index pages list

LightTPD htdoc should point to $EASYGSP_HOME/webapps 


{{{
     
    server.modules              = (
                                "mod_scgi",
                                "... all of the other mods"
                                ) 
 
      url.access-deny             	= ( "~", ".inc", "WEB-INF")
      static-file.exclude-extensions 	= (  ".gsp", ".gspx", ".groovy")
      index-file.names            	= (  "index.gspx", "index.gsp", "index.html", "index.htm", "default.htm", "index`")
      scgi.server  = (
                ".gspx" =>
			( "localhost" =>
				(
					"host" => "127.0.0.1",
					"port" =>  4444,
                                        "check-local" => "disable"  
				)
			),
		".gsp" =>
			( "localhost" =>
				(
					"host" => "127.0.0.1",
					"port" =>  4444,
                                        "check-local" => "disable"
				)
			)			
			
		)											

}}}
 





restart LightTPD

==Configuring Apache==

Modify httpd.conf to include the following:

{{{
         LoadModule scgi_module modules/mod_scgi.so
         SCGIMount / 127.0.0.1:4444
 
         <locationmatch (\.js|\.gif|\.jpg|\.ico|\.css|\.swf|\.png|\.tiff|\.jpeg|\.json|\.zip|\.tar\.gz|\.mp3|\.doc)+$>
	     SCGIHandler Off
         </locationmatch>
         <locationmatch "/images|css|js|docs/">
	     SCGIHandler Off
         </locationmatch>

         <IfModule dir_module>
             DirectoryIndex index.gspx index.gsp index.html
         </IfModule>

         # point to $EASYGSP_HOME/webapps
         DocumentRoot "C:/easygsp/webapps"

         # point to $EASYGSP_HOME/webapps         
         <Directory "C:/easygsp/webapps">
           Options FollowSymLinks

           AllowOverride None

           Order allow,deny
           Allow from all
         </Directory>

}}}

mod_scgi can be downloaded [http://bigonez.googlepages.com/ here] for windows users 

Create EASYGSP_HOME and JAVA_HOME environment variables that point to the installation directories.

restart Apache
